content:
Diagnosis:
T2bN1M0 squamous cell carcinoma of left lower lobe lung

Previous treatment:
Completed 4 cycles carboplatin/gemcitabine March-May 2024
Partial response achieved on CT 1 June 2024

Current medications:
Dexamethasone 4mg bd
Aprepitant
Metoclopramide prn

Current situation:
Seen following completion of chemotherapy with recent CT showing good partial response. Performance status remains 1.

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of 4 cycles of carboplatin and gemcitabine chemotherapy. The recent CT scan from 1st June shows an excellent partial response with the primary mass reducing from 4.8cm to 2.1cm, and near complete resolution of hilar lymphadenopathy. His cough has significantly improved and he has regained 3kg of weight.

He has experienced grade 2 fatigue and grade 1 nausea during chemotherapy but overall tolerated treatment well. His most recent blood tests show stable renal function and acceptable haematological parameters.

Given his high PD-L1 expression (95%) and good performance status, we discussed transitioning to maintenance immunotherapy with pembrolizumab. I have explained the rationale, procedure, and potential side effects including immune-related adverse events. [redacted name] understands the monitoring requirements and has been given written information about immunotherapy.

Plan:
To commence pembrolizumab 200mg every 3 weeks
Baseline thyroid function, cortisol, and chest x-ray arranged
Review in 3 weeks with blood tests prior
CT scan after 4 cycles of immunotherapy

Completed 4 cycles carboplatin/gemcitabine with good partial response

patient_facts.value: Stable renal function and acceptable haematological parameters

status_updates.value: Locally advanced lung cancer showing good partial response to initial chemotherapy. Planning transition to maintenance immunotherapy.
Excellent partial response with primary mass reduction and symptom improvement
Grade 2 fatigue and grade 1 nausea during chemotherapy
Plan to commence pembrolizumab 200mg every 3 weeks as maintenance therapy
Baseline thyroid function, cortisol, chest x-ray and CT scan after 4 cycles
Review in 3 weeks with blood tests
